snippet: Obama administration officials are proposing to correct a bureaucratic Catch-22 that separated families for as long as a decade.
abstract: Obama administration proposes fix to immigration laws that could spare hundreds of thousands of American citizens from prolonged separations from illegal immigrant spouses and children; fix is one of a number of recent measures that do not require the approval of Congress, designed to ease the effect on immigrant communities of contradictory or outmoded statutes.
lead_paragraph: Obama administration officials are proposing to correct a bureaucratic Catch-22 that separated families for as long as a decade.

headline.seo: Path to Green Card for Illegal Immigrant Family Members of Americans
headline.main: Tweak in Rule to Ease a Path to Green Card
headline.print_headline: Tweak in Rule To Ease a Path To Green Card
